sentence.Network_en: He had a bed and a fireplace and everything.

sentence.Network_en: I was forever dragging him away from the fireplace.
sentence.Network_cn: 我老是要把他从壁炉边拉开。

sentence.Network_en: The wall caved in to reveal a blocked-up Victorian fireplace.

entry.def: In a room, the fireplace is the place where a fire can be lit and the area on the wall and floor surrounding this place.

means.word_mean: 1. an open recess in a wall at the base of a chimney where a fire can be built;

sentences.sentence: "the fireplace was so large you could walk inside it"
"he laid a fire in the hearth and lit it"
"the hearth was black with the charcoal of many fires"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 移置, 转移, 取代, 置换
stems_affixes.word_buile: displace取代,替换+ment表名词→n.移置, 转移, 取代, 置换
fire火+place放,地方→生火的地方→壁炉

stems_affixes.value_cn: 地方, 地点, 位置
stems_affixes.word_buile: place放,地方→n.地方, 地点, 位置 v.放置

stems_affixes.value_cn: 取代,替换,替换物,代替物
stems_affixes.word_buile: replace代替+ment表名词→n.取代,替换,替换物,代替物
dis去掉+place放,地方→把放的东西去掉
place放,地方→n.地方, 地点, 位置 v.放置

stems_affixes.value_cn: 取代,替换,代替,把……放回原处
stems_affixes.word_buile: re重新+place放,地方→重新放→复职,引申为"代替"

Sentence.sentence: And a room with books in it induces, at least in some, a feeling not dissimilar to that of a fire in the fireplace on a cold winter's night.
A house with a fireplace has a stronger appeal to buyers
But functioning fireplaces remain to this day a powerful selling point in a house or apartment.

sentences.en: The flames of the fire licked the sides of the fireplace.
sentences.cn: 火焰卷烧着壁炉的边缘。
